cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles ESE of Marathon, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW across the Florida Keys into the eastern Gulf of Mexico and then northwest toward the central Gulf Coast (MS/AL coasts and southeast Louisiana)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi-Alabama border, with the center passing very close to Plaquemines Parish, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama-Florida border westward to east of Morgan City, Louisiana, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible late Tuesday night into Wednesday with a 37% cumulative probability.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water levels could reach 2–4 ft above ground near the Mouth of the Mississippi River if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with locally higher totals possible; flooding in low-lying areas cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and elevated wave action may disrupt vessel traffic and cargo operations.
